column4: Breakingviews: Verizon workers bolster unions' cautious comeback
column5: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Verizon Communications  workers are bolstering unions' cautious comeback. The telecom company's staff walked out in one of the largest U.S. strikes in years after contract talks stalled. Add a Supreme Court win  minimum-wage hikes and a big role in presidential races  and organized labor's future begins to look a bit brighter.
